citations.narrative:
The facility is not following the vaccination schedule in the written Program of Veterinary Care (PVC). The PVC states to
administer Rabies vaccinations at 16 weeks of age. Records did not show that French Bulldog (#4414) had received this
vaccination. Additionally, the PVC states that animals are to receive Distemper and Parvovirus vaccines (7-way) at 11 and
16 weeks of age, records did not show that the animal received these vaccinations. The facility also could not confirm that
the animal received these vaccinations.
Failure to administer required vaccines in accordance with a veterinary approved schedule may result in animals to not be
adequately protected against disease and can cause pain and distress. Correct by ensuring all animals are vaccinated in
accordance with the schedule approved by the Attending Veterinarian and contact the Attending Veterinarian to create a
plan to determine when to administer future vaccinations for this animal.

The facility does not maintain complete medical records for all animals. Records for French Bulldog (4418) and French
Bulldog (4402) state that the Attending Veterinarian instructed the facility to give a Distemper and Parvovirus booster
vaccine (7-way) on 10-22-2025. The facility states that these animals did receive the vaccination but they did not record
that information in the medical record.
Failure to maintain adequate medical records may interfere with the ability of APHIS officials to determine if the animals
are receiving adequate veterinary care. Complete medical records must be maintained and include the names of all
vaccines and treatments administered and the dates of administration. Correct by documenting all treatments given and
ensure that medical records are complete and contain the required information. Correct by 24-DEC-2025.
This inspection was conducted with a Facility Representative and the exit interview was conducted with the Licensee.
n

narrative:
3.13(a)(3)  Repeat
   
Veterinary care for dogs. 
The facility is not following the vaccination schedule in the written Program of Veterinary Care (PVC). The PVC states to 
administer Rabies vaccinations at 16 weeks of age. Records did not show that French Bulldog (#4414) had received this 
vaccination. Additionally, the PVC states that animals are to receive Distemper and Parvovirus vaccines (7-way) at 11 and 
16 weeks of age, records did not show that the animal received these vaccinations. The facility also could not confirm that 
the animal received these vaccinations. 
 
Failure to administer required vaccines in accordance with a veterinary approved schedule may result in animals to not be 
adequately protected against disease and can cause pain and distress. Correct by ensuring all animals are vaccinated in 
accordance with the schedule approved by the Attending Veterinarian and contact the Attending Veterinarian to create a 
plan to determine when to administer future vaccinations for this animal. 
3.13(b)(3) 
   
Veterinary care for dogs. 
The facility does not maintain complete medical records for all animals. Records for French Bulldog (4418) and French 
Bulldog (4402) state that the Attending Veterinarian instructed the facility to give a Distemper and Parvovirus booster 
vaccine (7-way) on 10-22-2025. The facility states that these animals did receive the vaccination but they did not record 
that information in the medical record. 
 
Failure to maintain adequate medical records may interfere with the ability of APHIS officials to determine if the animals 
are receiving adequate veterinary care. Complete medical records must be maintained and include the names of all 
vaccines and treatments administered and the dates of administration. Correct by documenting all treatments given and 
ensure that medical records are complete and contain the required information. Correct by 24-DEC-2025. 
 
This inspection was conducted with a Facility Representative and the exit interview was conducted with the Licensee.

n
